column4: I can't seem to enter the GRUB settings on boot, neither with pressing shift nor ESC
ive had quirky desktop systems taht grub would not properly work with a USB keyboard. but would with a PS2 keyvoard..  there  a legacy-usb setting the bios that might fix that.
I'm trying to manually edit the grub.cfg with nano now
thats one way.. not a great way.. but a way
the proper way is edit the /etc/default/grub then rerun update-grub
I see, thanks - I'm trying if it works and then I'll do it the proper way
that means grub is sending info that the monitor cant handle.
i have to tell grub to use a 640x480 res screen here for this monitor.. heres my grub.cfg
edit /etc/default/grub and uncomment the 640x480 line, uncomment the 'make a sound beep' line also so you can hear it beep so you know it booted if it dosent work. :) and run update-grub
sounds like   the framebuffer/plymouth stuff is causing problems  once again.
enable the text menu for grub. and  remove the 'quiet splash'  words in the /etc/default/grub
I did as you said and edited the /default/grub file
dont forget to run update-grub after editing..
in /etc/default/grub --->    GRUB_GFXMODE=640x480   and   GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="text" is about as low-tech/should alwasy work.. as you can get...
